channel.title: FakeFactory Cinematic Mod
channel.description:
[url='https://cinematicmod.com/index.php']https://cinematicmod.com/index.php[/url]
Had anyone ever heard about this Mod? Is it good?
Because of Black Mesa I wanted to replay HL2 and remembered some dudes where doing a mod in order to pimp up the graphics.
I am downloading right now.

item.title: FakeFactory Cinematic Mod
item.dc:creator: Starzaka
item.description:
CM12 with the bloom and sunrays set to moderate, vignetting, enb, and film noir colors make the game look stunning. I also love how smooth the engine runs with the new version, even with some lag on my midrange card it runs without any distracting jerkiness. The only things I’ve never liked about CM tho is the fact he makes slutty alyx variants in the first place(whether you can use the original model or not is a moot point) and the cinematic soundtrack. I think it would be much better if fakefactory composed his OWN cinematic style music rather than copy pasting some movie osts and calling it a day. It would make the project more genuine.

Read full topic

item.title: FakeFactory Cinematic Mod
item.dc:creator: B3rtm3n
item.description:
The character models depends more on taste I think, they look pretty good as do the rest.

I am replacing all screenshots of HL2 with those of Cinema Mod as I play. I really like CM12.

Half Life 2
Episode1
Episode 2

CM12 still is LE (light edition without the HD characters) but in the full version you can pick which ones you like, vanilla or hd.

Read full topic

item.title: FakeFactory Cinematic Mod
item.dc:creator: Dotard
item.description:
CM 12 looks awesome, his skills with environments precede the character models. Most of them look even worse than the originals (modelling-wise, G-man for example looks like someone from X-files and the other variant like a grandpa) so… it’s best to use the original models for the main characters, Breen model is very decent, same for Mossman (even though she looks too young, so that might need a fixing) as for the citizens, HD are okay in most cases.
Combine look good by default, not really digging them in Star Wars uniforms or what’s that.

Read full topic

item.title: FakeFactory Cinematic Mod
item.dc:creator: dinnsfire5
item.description:
The idea has potential, it just has poor execution. Giving HL2 a darker tone would be sick, but instead, he models characters after super-models instead of giving them a more realistic (yet still, sexy) look.

I really like the music, because I love soundtrack music. He mostly uses Batman Music (I’m pretty sure this whole project was inspired by TDK)

Also, if there were first person cinematic, such as interactive sequences like CoD, it would make the mod worth playing (instead of just playing a copy of HL2 that was painted over)

All in all, he needs to cut back on what he’s doing, and instead of sticking HL2 on overdrive, he should make it a slightly more CINEMATIC experience rather than one that makes you horny after playing for 20+ minutes. (Guilty as charged)

Read full topic

item.title: FakeFactory Cinematic Mod
item.dc:creator: Fnork
item.description:
I played it for a bit a while back, can’t remember which version though.

The parts that I really liked were the improved shadows and reflections and such, but all the other shit I could have gladly gone without.
I played without the new models, but even some of the changed textures just seemed weird and out of place, sometimes they were just too realistic (in a sense that they were probably just photographs and barely processed) and oddly pasted over models that didn’t have the right polygons.

As I said in another thread a few months back, the guy has talent when it comes to asset-making and building terrain, but he simply has poor taste and doesn’t seem to know what actually fits.

Fakefactory would work a lot better as a member of a team, where he would be restricted and could only do what he actually knows anything about. As it is now it’s like letting your set designer direct and episode of your show, or a construction worker be the architect of a building.

In any case, I think I’m actually going to give some “lite” version another shot, though. When last I tried it I could barely run it, but my computer has been upgraded, and I figure, what the hell, I don’t have anything better to do.

Read full topic

item.title: FakeFactory Cinematic Mod
item.dc:creator: B3rtm3n
item.description:
I tried the 12 on xp 32 bit

It only runs on 64 bit systems but on 32 bit it crashes when loading the next level

It looked so good in xp 32 bit that I just bought Win7 64-bit in order to be able to play the complete mod

Keep you informed!

Read full topic

I see there is a 12, would anyone recommend that?

item.title: FakeFactory Cinematic Mod
item.dc:creator: Hauser
item.description:
I downloaded it and tried the first map. I didn’t like it. It looked of amateur hour. Like he changed the texture of the coke can to coca-cola which is a trademark and breaks the atmosphere. Also he used huge texture re-skins on models which are completely unnecessary and just make the system memory requirement ridiculous. Randomly using huge 2048 x 2048 textures on everything doesn’t make it HD, better graphics would be achieved by a more clever and liberal use of it. I think just rebaking the model texture with better AO would make a world of difference. The mod messes up alot of lighting details like you walk into that part in the first map with barney and changed the lighting to red. Also there was random things thrown around the maps like boxes which when hit caused a frame rate drop from the havoc physics. If the author of this made those models, hes got skill for character modeling, but has much to learn about good level design.

Read full topic

item.title: FakeFactory Cinematic Mod
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
I hated CM 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9 and 10 but CM 11 is quite good because it adds EP2 foliage and trees to regular HL2, which may lag on some computers but on mine it doesn’t and looks great.

I have all character models restored to the originals though.

Read full topic

item.title: FakeFactory Cinematic Mod
item.dc:creator: _rot_fodder
item.description:
A scientist:

It may look good, but it’s only the same story with a different gloss on it really.
No different to replaying the entire HL2 series.

Be disappointed with a graphics mod because it doesn’t change the story.

Indeed.

item.title: FakeFactory Cinematic Mod
item.dc:creator: B3rtm3n
item.description:
I have been playing the latest version (11) but it has no HD characters yet and version 4. From version 5 on a 64bit OS is required.

There is a huge difference between early versions and latest versions.

Version 4 is terrible, especially the HD characters and I agree it should be avoided.

Version 11 is a different story. Unfortunately it requires a 64 bit os and I could only play the first level but I think it is fantastic how it looks and the work which has been done.
A lot of additional details have been added and it looks very good.

I do not know which version you people have been playing but how version 11 looks right now I think it is a keeper.

I had a look at Filip Victor’s HL2 Update (version 3 is due this year), it looks good and probably I will install it too (thanks for the link) but FakeFactory Cinematic Mod 11 looks way much better.

Read full topic

item.title: FakeFactory Cinematic Mod
item.dc:creator: Crypt
item.description:
In my opinion, I guess it’s good for what it’s trying to be (except for slutty females, fuck that), and it looks kinda nice, I suppose, so in it’s own right it’s not bad.

But as stated before if you’re expecting it to stay the course with Half-Life and not Hollywood don’t play it, you’ll be disappointed.

Read full topic

item.title: FakeFactory Cinematic Mod
item.dc:creator: Conti
item.description:
Bloodshot:

Let me warn you, if you like HL2’s aesthetics, and if you like level detail that makes sense, Cinematic mod is not for you.

^ What he said. I recommend Filip Victor’s HL2 Update for a more “vanilla” HL2 aesthetics with pimped graphics.

IMO Cinematic Mod deviates too much from the original. I like it too, but not so much as I like the HL2 Update Mod.

Read full topic

Let me warn you, if you like HL2’s aesthetics, and if you like level detail that makes sense, Cinematic mod is not for you.

item.title: FakeFactory Cinematic Mod
item.dc:creator: _rot_fodder
item.description:
It’s kind of interesting in it’s own right I suppose if it had to be, but I honestly can’t stand it. I tried to play through half life with it a while ago, but I just couldn’t finish it. Try it for yourself, it will certainly be an… experience. I wouldn’t recommend it though.

Read full topic
